text:
more :bikeshed: : Should I call the sensitivity of the output the `output_tangent` in `frule_test`,
and the `output_cotangent` in `rrule_test`
or just call them both `output_tangent`   for conciseness.
Could use another name like `output_partial` or `output_sensitivity`  (though even that tends to imply reverse right?)
<https://github.com/JuliaDiff/ChainRulesTestUtils.jl/pull/116#discussion_r570616871>

elements.text: : Should I call the sensitivity of the output the

for conciseness.
Could use another name like
(though even that tends to imply reverse right?)

text: So long as both being `output_tangent` isn't too objectionally incorrect to anyone, go with that. Slims down maths jargon and keeps consistency in the interface
